description: Borrowed from Middle French loyal, from Old French loial, leial, leal, from Latin lēgālis. Doublet of legal and leal.

adjectives.description: loyal (comparative loyaler or loyaller, superlative loyalest or loyallest)

entries.meaning: Having or demonstrating undivided and constant support for someone or something.
examples: Dogs are very loyal animals, which is why they make wonderful pets.
George is a loyal and loving husband.

entries.meaning: Firm in allegiance to a person or institution.
Faithful to a person or cause.
examples: We must remain loyal to the mission.
